item.title: On Falling Apart at the Office
item.description:
On Falling Apart at the Office

I. Office Victorians In the 19th century, British explorers were famous for not getting stressed.

item.title: Is Silicon Valley in Another Bubble . . . and What Could Burst It?
item.description:
Is Silicon Valley in Another Bubble . . . and What Could Burst It?

One Thursday morning in early June, the ballroom of the Rosewood Sand Hill hotel, in Menlo Park, was closed for a private presentation. The grand banquet hall appeared worthy of the sprawling resort's five-star designation: ornate chandeliers hung from the ceiling; silk panels with a silver stenciled design covered the walls.

item.title: Consumer Education: On Learning How to Spend
item.description:
Consumer Education: On Learning How to Spend

Society takes the business of making money very seriously indeed. Much of our education system is geared towards giving people the skills to get a good job and a steady income.

item.title: The Elaborate Charade to Obfuscate Who Writes Pop Music
item.description:
The Elaborate Charade to Obfuscate Who Writes Pop Music

Meet the bald Norwegians and other unknowns who actually create the songs that top the charts.

item.title: The American Dream House Hasn't Worked for Real People
item.description:
The American Dream House Hasn't Worked for Real People

Leisure and domestic bliss never seemed to materialize as promised. But over the years people have found ways to break down the standard designs and craft spaces of their own.

item.title: Inside the Secretive World of Elite Wealth Management
item.description:
Inside the Secretive World of Elite Wealth Management

A sociologist realized that if she were ever going to understand global inequality she would have to become one of the people who helps create it. So she trained to become a wealth manager to the ultra-rich.

item.title: Why I Quit Ordering From Uber-for-Food Start-Ups
item.description:
Why I Quit Ordering From Uber-for-Food Start-Ups

The food was decent, but the vibes were dystopian. Please consider disabling it for our site, or supporting our work in one of these ways Subscribe Now > Josephine doesn't prepare any meals itself. Instead, it screens home cooks and takes orders on their behalf.
